pr_title: Notification Open now uses an Activity instead of Broadcast

timeline.message:
Notification Open should use Activity instead of Broadcast

* Switch to using NotificationOpenedActivity.class in GenerateNotification.java
* Remove Intent flags from startOrResumeApp and use Activity Context instead of the normal context
* Update tests to account for the new behavior

timeline.bodyText: Mike tried to switch this notification dismiss action to an Activity before in the past and it resulted in a visual flicker. Do these flags completely prevent that?
timeline.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: good catch! there is no flicker but the process is being closed
replies.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: We might have to use a BroadcastReceiver for the dismisses. If we use an Activity for dismisses it could result in odd focus behavior in the app with extra onPause and onResume calls each time a notification is swiped away we would want to avoid.
replies.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: Yeah, seems like the most reasonable solution, using intent for dismissing tracking, ends on weirds behaviors
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: Instead of NotificationOpenedActivity shouldn't this be NotificationOpenedReceiver or NotificationDismissReceiver?
timeline.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: The more correct terminology would be "dismissed" instead of "closed" for a notification.
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
This runtime check was in place since there was a change in a non-major release and we had to support both as someone may not have updated their AndroidManifest.xml.
We can now just safely assume NotificationDismissReceiver will always be there now in 4.0.0
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: We can safely remove the openerIsBroadcast check as the open action will always be an Activity
